title: Laboratory in Animal Behavior
description: This course provides an opportunity to learn about the various evolutionary forces that shape a species’ natural behavioral repertoire while also conducting research related to these issues. Classroom lectures on topics related to ethology will be complemented by a research project in which students collect observational data on animal behavior. Open to the following majors only: PC26, PC28, PC29, PC30, PC31, PC32, PC33, PC34, CG32. Prerequisites: upper-division standing, PSYC 60 or COGS 14B and PSYC 70 or COGS 14A, and department approval.
